mapper.sql: SELECT a.user_id as userId, a.name as name, a.introduce as introduce, a.telephone as telephone, a.mobilephone as mobilephone, a.create_date as createDate, a.update_date as updateDate, a.email as email, a.birthday as birthday, a.gender as gender, a.starff_id as starffId, a.position as position, a.type as type, b.user_id as "userAccount.userId", b.create_time as "userAccount.createTime", b.password as "userAccount.password", b.salt as "userAccount.salt", b.status as "userAccount.status", b.account as "userAccount.account", b.email as "userAccount.email", b.mobilephone as "userAccount.mobilephone", d.role_id as "role.roleId", d.name as "role.name", d.description as "role.description", f.org_id as "org.id", f.name as "org.name", f.description as "org.description", f.priority as "org.priority", f.parent_id as "org.parentId", f.root_id as "org.rootId" FROM manage_user_profile a join manage_user_account b on a.user_id = b.user_id left join manage_user_role c on a.user_id = c.user_id left join manage_role d on c.role_id = d.role_id left join manage_user_organization e on a.user_id = e.user_id left join manage_organization f on e.org_id = f.org_id

mapper.insert: insert into manage_user_profile( user_id, name, introduce, telephone, mobilephone, create_date, update_date, email, birthday, gender, starff_id, position, type ) values( #{userId}, #{name}, #{introduce}, #{telephone}, #{mobilephone}, #{createDate}, #{updateDate}, #{email}, #{birthday}, #{gender}, #{starffId}, #{position}, #{type} )
mapper.update: UPDATE manage_user_profile SET name = #{name}, introduce = #{introduce}, telephone = #{telephone}, mobilephone = #{mobilephone}, update_date = #{updateDate}, email = #{email}, birthday = #{birthday}, gender = #{gender}, starff_id = #{starffId}, position = #{position} WHERE user_id = #{userId}
